snippet: Gary Satin, 62, a former Long Island Railroad employee, said he had schemed to steal from a federal pension agency by pretending to be disabled.
abstract: Former Long Island Railroad employee Gary Satin pleads guilty in Manhattan federal court to conspiracy and perjury charges, admitting scheme to steal from a federal pension agency by pretending to be disabled; about 20 defendants have been charged in a major fraud scheme that prosecutors say could have cost the Railroad Retirement Board more than $1 billion if all the money had been fully disbursed; Satin, the only person to plead guilty thus far, faces up to 10 years in prison.
lead_paragraph: Gary Satin, 62, a former Long Island Railroad employee, said he had schemed to steal from a federal pension agency by pretending to be disabled.
